Description: Scarab, made of glazed steatite, completely preserved. Remains of a beige glaze preserved, the steatite is beige. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single line. The division between prothorax and elytra is indicated by a short vertical groove at each side. The humeral callosities are indicated by a short vertical line at the site, slightly bent inwards. The shape of the head is oval and bears four thin vertical grooves The clypeus shows four slightly broader grooves, dividing it into five lobes. The side of the scarab shows one circumferential line, separating the scarab from the base plate, no legs are indicated. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. At both ends a longitudinal nb-basket framing the hieroglyphs 'Imn-Ra in the middle. The orientation of the seal is transversal while the perforation of the object is longitudinal.
